website_summaries.verdict: Very good optics for its price, but the exterior casing’s build quality is just so-so, and its included tripod is small and flimsy.
pros: Easy to spot shots on targets at 100 yards, even from smaller caliber bullets
Lens caps are easy to take off and put on
Can range out past 300 yards easily, with bright optics and good focus through entire zoom range
cons: Angled viewing is awkward for some uses
Included tripod is cheap and difficult to stabilize
Adjustment knob’s threads can strip easily if not centered correctly
Focus can be less crisp when zooming to 200+ yards

customer_reviews.title: Great budget scope!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great spotting scope for any use. You can see how clear my phone takes pictures of the moon with this scope. The pictures were taken at 20x, 40x, and 60x zoom. Im impressed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great scope
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use for looking at rivers and mountains and birds. Great quality, super clear to me. Picture are a little blurry because I just held my phone to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Webster

customer_reviews.title: at first i did not like it but then i got used to it
customer_reviews.text: i started to love with this product .amazing quality and unbelievably easy to take care
customer_reviews.author: Tatish 4K

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time. Works great. I can see the target at 150 yards with no problem. I would give it a 5 star rating if the thing you look into would rotate so as to allow looking in from the side rather than always from the top. I hate to use the phrase, "Great for the money" because that makes it appear cheap. But it is really great and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas John

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product.
customer_reviews.text: Rarely if ever do reviews but this product is definitely worth the price and absolutely what I was looking for. Pic is approx 40yds away and looks like 3" away. Absolutely great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not up to specs
customer_reviews.text: The listed amplification of image is misleading. Description indicates you get from 20 x to 60x of the unaided eye amplification. 'adjustable 20x to 60x magnification'. It appears comparable to my Nikon scope that goes from 3.5 to 14 zoom. Suprised people rate it so high as for target verification at over 300ft its not powerful as indicated or useful to see hits on paper.
customer_reviews.author: Yo

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good scope
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's a decent scope. I decided to return it because I wanted something a little higher quality, but to do that I ended up spending twice as much money and in the end, I think this scope was just as good as the Bushnell that I ended up getting.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Robert Willett

customer_reviews.title: Childs toy, save your money for a real scope.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this scope for target shooting boy was that a mistake. At 100 yards the scope wouldn't focus, at 50 yards could barely get it to focus. Thought maybe I received a bad scope nope exchanged for another one ( same scope ) and it did no better. Lenses were plastic and it was like a child's toy. Well I did return it , thank heaven for Amazons return policy. I guess you do get what you pay for. Oh well it sounded to good to be true, don't know what others are useing this scope for but it's no better than a kids toy.
customer_reviews.author: Claudie

customer_reviews.title: Below Average
customer_reviews.text: I got a much better view of items at the same distance of about a mile on a hillside near my home using 10x40 binoculars by wingspan. For something that has this much power, it does not produce images with clarity to identify what is there. It also does not have adjustable eye cup to help with ease of use. And, it was only halfway decent at the lowest of the zooms (20x). When I moved it to 60x zoom, the field gets so small that it's difficult to look through for long. It does magnify, but, not with good clarity. So, not happy with the overall design. It's not bad, it's not great. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Romin Hawk

customer_reviews.title: I was finally pleased to know I found my spotting scope that I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several units with the same specs as this model and price. They have all been a dis-appointment. I read the reviews and decided to give this one a shot. When it arrived, the first test was to see if I could view my bullet impacts at 50 yds at 60x magnification. PASSED!!! All the other units were distorted at 60x. I was finally pleased to know I found my spotting scope that I could actually see my POI on 60x CLEARLY!! Now if they only had packaged this with a telescoping tri-pod would be 6 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jamison

customer_reviews.title: Never worked
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I finally had the opportunity to use it and couldn't see a dam thing. Several family members tried it out with the same result. Sometimes you might see something but very difficult. Only good thing about it how light a compact it is. So sad wish I could give a good review.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great value for shooters
customer_reviews.text: Clear focus, long range, fair price.. I can very clearly see holes in my targets at 200 yards. Haven't checked this on a longer range but I can see equivalent size details and defects on the side of a church steeple that I estimate is about 350 yards away. The only tradeoff for the price of this scope is shifted tinting of objects at high magnification. So maybe this scope is not best for long-range bird watching -- but great value for shooters.
customer_reviews.author: Albert J Cacace

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable for the price, check out photos of Emarth vs. Viper Optics HD
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Viper Optics HD (seven hundred bucks) and this one. I returned the Viper and kept this scope. The biggest difference between the two was the field of view at max focus. The clarity was similar. Notice the "No Parking" sign in the two photos. These images are at 60x for the Emarth and 45x for the Viper at 800 meters. Unquestionably the Viper was clearer, but was the difference worth 20X the price of this scope. Not to me. Only con is the tripod which is wobbly, but for the price, I am not complaining.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Biggest bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: This spotting scope is awesome! It has multi-coated glass and is lightweight for hunting. The rubberized protective coating is nice. Was struggling on trying to decide whether or not to buy a vortex or Leopold spotting scope but thought I would take a chance on this scope which has really good reviews. Highly recommend for hunters and target shooters who don’t want to spend +$300 on a sporting scope. Perfect for the range and the hillside. You won’t regret buying this spotting scope.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth any amount of money
customer_reviews.text: Very very cheap. Can see better with the naked eye. My grandson didn’t even want it.
customer_reviews.author: Tris Martin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Very much worth the price. Doesn’t look as clear in the photos I took, but trust me its clear in person.
customer_reviews.author: rafael paredez

customer_reviews.title: surprising clarity for cost
customer_reviews.text: for price paid, I figured "why not?" we have a new deck and wanted to obtain a scope we could leave out in the gazebo so a $1300 spotting scope wasn't on option - was willing to take a risk on a "cheap, not so good" scope - but using today & WOW it's amazing and exceeding all expectations for clarity and ease of use. Small & packable too. At about 300 meters (1000 feet), can see moths (not type, just movement) fluttering above a meadow. Very pleased with this scope. Although there may be better spotting scope out there - I bet they also cost many hundreds of dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Quality test —> See my picture.
customer_reviews.text: Worth it! Look at my picture using the Apple iPhone 8 simply aligned through the eye piece. Camera METAdata 3mm - f3 - 0/3s - iso 32 I’d say given that result, Worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Unknown

customer_reviews.title: This scope is total junk.
customer_reviews.text: I was never able to get a clear focus at any magnification, and returned it immediately. 'Emarth'? Really? Don't waste your time and money on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Bob O

customer_reviews.title: Very good deal. Half the cost of similar models but full satisfaction in quality and function.
customer_reviews.text: I compared several similar models on Optics Planet. This was 50 per cent cheaper than similar. When it arrived, I was pleasantly surprised at the extras. Everything is quality. The scope even comes with a very nice soft case with divided compartments for carrying the tripod and accessories. Brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: bmw325alex

customer_reviews.title: but I suspect there are better options if you need to go further than that
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for when I go to the range so I don't have to walk down to see my hits. It works okay at 100 yards and at 20x power, but fades at longer ranges. It is hard to get a crisp focus at longer ranges and as the magnification goes up, the eye relief gets to the point you almost have to have your eye touching the eyepiece. This is a pain if you are wearing eye protection. I will keep it since it does okay at 100 yards, but I suspect there are better options if you need to go further than that.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: I chose this scope because it had great reviews and had a great price
customer_reviews.text: I chose this scope because it had great reviews and had a great price. I was not disappointed. I wanted one with more soon so I bought one that is x90 from another brand. It looked almost the same but that one was dimmer and slightly blurry even at x60. I set both up side by side looking at the same item at same zoom. I would highly recommend this scope.
customer_reviews.author: John N

customer_reviews.title: returned it for Roxant
customer_reviews.text: Was unhappy with the field of view and the instructions say (step 7) that the eyepiece rotates in and out, (which it does not) Emailed the company and they said the instructions are wrong? Eyepiece rubber end rolls up and down but is worthless. Loses clarity past 35 or 40 magnification. Lens protectors came off and would eventually get lost. Small focus knob is hard to adjust with gloves. Tripod was good quality though. Probably Ok for price but got the Roxant instead and its better.
customer_reviews.author: RIck Vander Weide

customer_reviews.title: Great Spotter Scope
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned with the price being so affordable but when I got it I was surprised. Easy to focus, great eye relief and great price. I just got it to sight in my guns at the range and find myself using it watching animals around the house. I would recommenced this to anyone. The carry case was an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not clear at high magnification.
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit but not very clear at high magnification. Probably the best I can do for under $100. Seems like it will work fine for range use for 200 yards or less. I don’t know what I was expecting for the money. UPDATE I’m returning the scope. Went to the range today and just couldn’t get a clear image at100 yards. I could make out hits at 50 yards but so blurry at 100 I had trouble making out hits. At 150 totally blurry and 200 forget it. The scope on my rifle is so much clearer I had to use that.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: depends on what you're using it for
customer_reviews.text: Came nicely packaged. Lightweight for its size. Tripod is acceptable. Good carrying pouch. It is clear and easy to use. Now I purchase this to use at the gun range. Struggled at a hundred yards. also it came with some Nicks maybe they were blemishes on the green plastic housing. that being said or general use for $70 it's okay I did read the reviews and so many of the pictures and thought it would be better at least out to 200 yards which would have been acceptable at this point I plan to buy another
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For entry level item, its top notch in my humble opinion.
customer_reviews.text: Its my first spotting scope, but have owned many binoculars and rifle scopes. I find the build and clarity very good. Have used spotting targets out to 200 yds and spotting wildlife. Its been knocked about in a bag and mounted on a tripod and has held up so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Tough Guy

customer_reviews.title: ... was to help at the range to get a good view of targets at 100 yards for sight in
customer_reviews.text: First use was to help at the range to get a good view of targets at 100 yards for sight in. Worked great for that. Had it setup next to a Vortex spotting scope, the Vortex glass was clearer but I'm not complaining for the price. I will say the body of the scope doesn't seem that durable. Feel like if I dropped it on concrete it would break something. Other than that it's awesome for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Justin D.

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended, order a replacement tripod while you're here...
customer_reviews.text: The tripod is worthless. Broke right after unpacking before i even tried to attach the scope. I had planned for this and purchased a RetiCAM Tabletop Tripod at the same time as the scope. The scope is great for seeing down range as we're shooting rifles but the 60x is hard pressed to zoom into 200-250 yards. The price point is good, i'll use the scope as intended. The image is crisp and clear. Add the Gosky Universal Cell Phone Adapter Mount and you can use a cellphone instead of squinting through the scope.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Carrell

customer_reviews.title: Amazing spotting scope!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a couple of spotting scopes over the years but none of them has had the clarity of this one - regardless of the zoom power you select. I can almost but, fortunately, not quite, see someone taking a bath in a home across the valley from where I live with the scope at 60X. Hummingbirds in our trees look like eagles at 40X. It's relatively small and compact - east to transport. The tri-pod stand is solid. Excellent value for money!
customer_reviews.author: Sketchy

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool for the pistol or rifle range
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size for me to use on the pistol range where I can get instant feedback on how good or bad a shot was. Our county range does not have retrievable targets so without this scope I would have to wait for a cease-fire to be called before I could determine how my accuracy was. I am very happy with this scope.
customer_reviews.author: T. E. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: It's lightweight. That's about it. Tried to use it for some hunting. It was terrible. It was better to just use 10x binoculars to spot. This was completely worthless beyond 100 yards.
customer_reviews.author: ericaz

customer_reviews.title: a full sized tripod would be nice. Other than that it's an awesome value for ...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the quality of this spotting scope for the money, the one thing that you could actually put as an add on is a full size tripod, the tripod it comes with works well if your just sighting in your gun at the range because you have something to set it on, but if your out in the field for instance and your looking at animals or just sighting in your weapon, a full sized tripod would be nice. Other than that it's an awesome value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C.

customer_reviews.title: economical Spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: This spotting scope appears to be a good product for the price (I have only used it out to 300 yards). The scope would be able to function as intended if the "tripod" was more stable ( that is the negative of this scope). It has a nice "rubberized" finish that looks like it will protect the scope nicely, time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: popo22

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I'll get right into it. Would definitely not recommend for 1000m. Stretched it out to about 600 yards sighting in a 338 lapua. Without the help of a "splatter" target probably would not be about to tell where the bullet was hitting. Still a great bang for your buck, will sight easily at 200 yards.
customer_reviews.author: NP

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dad for his birthday. He used to just look out the window with binoculars as we have a great view of the mountains. Since we got him this new scope he probably spends an hour a day looking up at the mountains and spotting deer. For the price we could never have imagined it works this well. I’m sure the 3000 dollar spotting scopes can do a lot more but for this low of a price I have no regrets About buying it and would do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lee

customer_reviews.title: No complaints for sale price
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to completely dog this scope because for $45 it is pretty nice. However there is no adjustment for the eyecups it is fixed in place, so you have to wiggle your eye around to find a decent place to use it at, which heavily strains the eyes. The image is clear enough nothing amazing. Minimal color fringing up to 40x. After that don't even bother zooming in more because you wont see a thing except a dark nasty image. You will see .30 holes out to 100 yards maybe 200 but that is really pushing it.
customer_reviews.author: GrRecrot

customer_reviews.title: great scope for the money! awesome quality
customer_reviews.text: I've seen scopes that cost several hundred dollars, and they don't seem to have anything on this spotter. I can look across the city from my deck and read store signs that are several miles away. The moon, stars, etc., all easy to look at in detail. On the range you can check your hits at 100 yds easy. And it has a case, lens covers, tripod, locks into place in every direction just like the high-dollar scopes. And if I drop it off the balcony I didn't lose my whole paycheck. :-) Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice spotter scope with really good optics
customer_reviews.text: VERY good spotter scope. Optics are very clear. I set it up in my living room and was able to read house numbers on house approx. 400 yards distant. Field of View is good. Good carrying bag and short legged tripod. Perfect for shooters bench. To test it when it arrived I set it up on an inexpensive 5' camera tripod to read the house numbers at 400 yards. Verry good.
customer_reviews.author: EGH923

customer_reviews.title: Good Scope for the budget!
customer_reviews.text: Used scope on the 100 yd. clear and stable enuf for spotting our hits on a rainy n breezy day. Thanks for the prior reviews which were right on! Especially for the price! Hope this review helps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing Tripod
customer_reviews.text: The scope is crystal clear at 100....I bought this a while ago and just had the chance to take it out to the range. I was disappointed when I opened the pouch and found that there's no tripod included like it stated. This made it extremely difficult to use. Acquiring my target and keeping it steady was a big challenge. If not for that I'd rate this a value buy and 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Shift

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This spotting scopr is nice, sturdy and easy installtion. It comes with a carrying bag, which is nice. The distance is up 60x. When I look out, the object is crystal clear while anything nearby is blurry, which makes the target more stand out. It comes with the stand so it is easier to move the len. The design is ergonomic. If you ever want a spotting scope, this one canel be a good option.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Sung

customer_reviews.title: Don't be put off by the price,  the quality will surprise you.
customer_reviews.text: I had my reservations about getting this scope because of its price compared to others that are highly recommended. I am pleasantly surprised! I bought it for long range target archery. It comes with a table top tripod, but I'm using it on a 70" tripod. I have a nice view of an 18" block target at 80 yards. I focused in on an old weathered picket fence at the back of the range. I could make out the locations of the nails in the pickets at 100 yards. I'm sure there are better spotting scopes out there, but this scope is well worth the price and then some. No wonder it's Amazon's best seller!
customer_reviews.author: deafdumbblind

customer_reviews.title: Screw rod was stripped out!
customer_reviews.text: Open the box and went the adjust the tripod and the screw rod to hold it steady was stripped out and wouldn’t tighten down.
customer_reviews.author: DEVO

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressive Scope!
customer_reviews.text: This scope is quite large compared to others that I own. It is superior to all of my others. It is quick to find your target and zeros in easily. The tripod that comes with it has legs that are 9.5" long, perfect for the hood of a car. I have not experienced any distortion. For the price, and 800+ positive reviews, I think that anyone would be pleased with this scope!
customer_reviews.author: FLSTCKTTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I wear glasses and I have no problem looking through this scope at 20x. I am also very surprised how bright it is. I used it at night a few times and it renders the scene almost as good as the naked eye. Like other reviews, at 60x, then it is hard to see and I must take off my glasses before the scope is usable. But once my glasses are off and I refocus, it is amazing how clear and bright things are. I had other people try it too just to make sure I was not dreaming. Ha HA!!
customer_reviews.author: Jon B. Bushey

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: My friend has a konus scope And I used a bsa spotting scope for sighting in our Dept’s work rifles. I bought this one for an upgrade to my bsa . We took his konus and this smarty out to compare quality and picture. This one seems to have a better picture compared to his he was shocked when he used this one. For the money this is hands down one of the better. Heater options. Quit searching and buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Husband would give it 6 stars if he could.
customer_reviews.text: Husband uses the scope to train watch (we live about 1/4 of mile away from tracks) and he is able to read numbers and make out details. He says it is one of the best Christmas gifts I've given him. The delivery was timely and the scope was well packed. Haven't had any issues using it.
customer_reviews.author: VickiKay

customer_reviews.title: Nice scope for the money.
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with this scope, For the money it's very nice, Only gripe is the distance from your eye to the scope to see clearly is limited, you have to be about an inch away any further or closer and you can't see much.
customer_reviews.author: gary cather

customer_reviews.title: Sighting in a rifle scope? Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor had one and we used it while sighting in my rifle. No negative comments here. Out of the box, it was perfect. everything fit well. Everything came in the box. The individual joints can all be tightened down specifically to the angle you want. The first day, I set it up and looked around the neighborhood. It was crystal clear. You can easily adjust all the magnifications and pick out some details on objects 100+ yards out. The next step? Taking it to the range and see how it performs when target shooting with my rifles. For the price, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly great value
customer_reviews.text: I once bought a cheap spotting scope and quickly regretted it. I tried to put up with it as best I could but finally had to get something I could actually use. This scope is very clear at full magnification. I can easily see .22 bullet holes in a paper target at 100 yds., which was my initial requirement. It comes with a small tripod and a carrying case which holds both the scope and the tripod. I particularly liked the screw on cover for the ocular lens. When considering all the features and the quality for the price, this is a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick T. McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by the quality considering the price, a great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent spotting scope, factor in the cost and I don't know why someone wouldn't buy it for anny application. I tested it at 60x and didn't have any of the poor picture or color issues I feared when buying this. Good enough to be my primary spotting scope for hunting but cheap enough I don't mind the kids using for stargazing in the backyard. An overall great buy. The picture is a spike bull elk at about 250yds, the scope is at 60x magnification.
customer_reviews.author: Bill M

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the Price
customer_reviews.text: First I'll list the negatives. The case is pretty small, which means you'll have to search the tripod for storage. The tripod itself isn't real high quality, but it's at least stable. Now for the positive. You can make out .22LR holes on shoot and see type targets at around 200m. The optics are very clear. The unit feels fairly well-built. This is a great spring scope to use for zeroing optics at 100m (my primary use). I would highly recommend it for close range rifle spotting.
customer_reviews.author: Zeph

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Scope!
customer_reviews.text: Great scope! Took to the range got compliments after someone asked to use. They said how much did you pay 180-200 dollars told him what amazon had it and he was amazed. Overall this scope allowed me to see clear hit marks at 100 yards. Eye relief isn’t the best also I hooked it up to my other camera bipod and it worked amazing. The small one seems fine but haven’t used it yet. Don’t be deterred because it’s not a “big name” spotting scope. It’s worth the money and it works!
customer_reviews.author: Josh Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: Awesome spotting scope. Was looking at all the different ones on Amazon and saw some in the hundreds of dollars so i did not expect much. Dont get to an outdoor range as often as i would like so i did not want to spend that much on something i would not use that often. Was really surprised. Target 150 yards out and on maximum magnification view was perfect. Was able to see all my hits easily. Not sure what the difference between this and something so much more expensive but this really did the trick. Cant see replacing it if i start making it to the range more or shooting further distances.
customer_reviews.author: Bargin Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Scope
customer_reviews.text: Nice scope, which was purchased for round spotting at a the range up to 200 yds. Nice compact carry case, folding tripod and protective lens caps. Very clear image out to (and beyond, I'm sure) 200 yds. Not sure how durable it would be out in the field on a hunt or such in rain or snow, but for range use it's an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: F250 Driver

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t ask for a better one
customer_reviews.text: I am a bird watcher and I have always used binoculars and I am amazed at what I have been missing.this spotting scope brings everything in so much more clear. I am 71 so after awhile the binoculars would begin to shake a little. With the scope everything is steady and I can sit and watch as long as I want. The price was much more than competitive.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hatcher

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this scope for archery, I shoot little ACG arrows up to 70 meters away. This scope has been great at seeing my little diameter arrows however I shot a bit in the rain this last week and the scope is not waterproof. Today was the first day I got to shoot in the sun with the scope after all the moisture I exposed it to earlier in the week and it fogged up.. If not for this I would have given it 5 stars because the optics are great, I can even make accurate line calls all the way out to 60 meters. Great for dry but don't take it into the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Very clear precise viewing
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift and was much appreciative. They could see the craters on the moon as well as view the squirrels in the trees.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Decent scope, great view.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking unit. Seems cheaply made on the exterior. The tripod that comes with is super cheap, difficult to line up with target. I'll get used to it. The 60x power is what I really needed, and although there is a lot of heat distortion when I tested it, was able to see the target well. Good budget spotting scope. You'll most likely want to upgrade the tripod to something useful though.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Williams

customer_reviews.title: Clear even at long distance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this spotting scope for the sole purpose of looking at my target at 500 yards. With precise adjustment I can see it perfectly where my grouping is and adjust my rifle scope accordingly. It's not a bad investment if you go to the range a lot, plus it comes with a small carrying bad and a tripod, perfect for range spotting.
customer_reviews.author: WY

customer_reviews.title: Recived on-time and item is as described
customer_reviews.text: Item was delivered on-time and as described, it was packaged well. On preliminary inspection the item appears to be in brand new cond and of acceptable quality, fit, and finish. On it's initial use it works as described, view appears clear and it is easy to use and focus, tripod is of decent quality and holds the scope well.. As I have not used it for what I bought it for yet IE: (seeing my shots on the target at the range) I cannot give it a higher review although so far I am happy with the item based on it's price, apparent quality, and function.
customer_reviews.author: Furscape

customer_reviews.title: Looks awesome - couldn't use it easily
customer_reviews.text: I think this is for hunters and day time use and people who know what the hell they're doing. I bought this for my 7 y/o nephew who loves astronomy. we just couldn't get it to focus and even during the day, it was a bit tough. I read reviews that you could use this for looking at the moon but it was too challenging for what we needed it for. So I took this back and got him an actual telescope and he LOVES it. I'll leave this one to the hunters! Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Emarth spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, i took it to range and checked it out, could not believe how clear it was. You could easily see the hits on target. So i asked this other shooter to come and look he says i have similar spotter. He comes over and his first comment was WoW which is printable. He could not believe how clear everything was. He asked mevfor brand name ingave to him. We were spotting 50 and 100 yards. Would highly recommend thisroduct.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: For The Money A Good Scope
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to take to the rifle range that a buddy has built, we can shoot at 100 yards. This spotting scope works pretty dang good, focus isn't crystal clear at the 60X setting but that could be my eyes, I'm old. For the money it's a good scope.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Pressley

customer_reviews.title: Hey I can see that
customer_reviews.text: Nice little spotter for not much money. Have used it at the range at 150 yards, and in my back yard shooting .177 at 10 meters. Can zoom right in and see it all. Plastic stand a a little cheese but what do you expect for this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J.Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've been impressed with this spotting scope- the views are very clear and sharp, and the zoom and focusing adjustments are smooth. The build quality seems quite good. I was particularly impressed with the edge-to-edge sharpness, which I wasn't expecting from a small refractor. I haven't yet tested it for astronomy, but I expect it will give good lunar views and maybe give some basic planetary views. I compared this to a $300 pair of binoculars and a $400 telescope, and this scope wasn't completely outclassed by the higher-priced optics. For the price, it gave pretty comparable views.
customer_reviews.author: Robimus

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price level.
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to help when sighting in my rifles at 50yds and 100yds a few times a year without breaking the bank. This was it. perfect to have on the bench next to the gun to check and get a clear view of the target. It does what I need but doubt it would be good for much else.
customer_reviews.author: James Miles

customer_reviews.title: Great scope
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scope a few months ago. I really like it. I'm using it for a few months. the Photo is from a church more than 1,5 km away from my place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive budget beginner affordable.
customer_reviews.text: Don't compare this to expensive high-end glass...it works amazingly well for the price. Very basic and very light. Comes with a cheap tripod and a cheap zippered case. Should last with proper care. Recommend to anyone on an ultra budget or perhaps for a kids gift.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Beat in the optics world
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a general use scope that can be used for a variety of activities, has good features, and is priced within the realm of reason for most outdoorsmen, you should really consider Emarth AE 20-60x60, it has the ideal amount of magnification for spotting, and the large objective lens lets in plenty of light without being excessively heavy. Its extra low dispersion glass gives it unbeatable image quality that you won’t get with very many other scopes, especially in that price range, I feel like they are the company to beat in the optics world right now.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Y. Alba

customer_reviews.title: Much better quality then I expected
customer_reviews.text: I had low expectations when I ordered this spotting scope but I must say it has well exceeded them it's is very clear even on its highest magnification feels very well made the tripod is nothing special but it will get the job done for range days
customer_reviews.author: joey

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: I like this scope. It lets me see eagles that are about 100 yards away much better. (But not into detail) Does take some time to get into focus and the pics with your phone are not really great. I wish it worked better to take pictures. So, it's okay but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Diane S.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I'm honestly surprised at the quality for the money. I needed something for my sport shooting, but I didn't want to really drop the $200+ dollars I've seen for other spotting scopes. I tried this out and am very happy. The colors of the objects that come through the lens aren't superb by any means (they are a little dull), but this thing gets the job done. I can see a target easily at 150 yds.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Pretty clear for cheap glass. Can see bullet holes at 100 yards without issue
customer_reviews.text: This scope is clear and powerful enough to see bullet holes in targets at 100 yards and that's what i bought it for so i am pleased with my purchase. The cheap plastic front cap arrived cracked, i'll probably just put a little super glue on it. Other than that i don't have any complaints for the money spent it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome!! *wife here* I ordered it for Christmas for my husband but tried it out to see if I wasted my money. I didn’t. I scoped out our windmill over 1000 yards out and the visual is crisp and beautiful!! Thank you he’ll love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: We could very easily see vapor trails even with high winds and busy ...
customer_reviews.text: BLOWN AWAY by this spotting scope. I bought it expecting to use it out to maybe 200 yds but it was clear as day at almost 500. We could very easily see vapor trails even with high winds and busy mirages. The eye relief is a bit close at 60x, so I needed to remove my eye-protection to use it, but that was a minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: Thorny

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first because I bought another inexpensive scope, highly rated, and it was terrible. I returned it and bought this one. Couldn't be happier. I was at the range and this one compared favorably to one used by a guy shooting next to me that he said he paid $500.00 for.
customer_reviews.author: D. Quesenberry

customer_reviews.title: Incredible performance for price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned many high end optics from Swarovski to Leica to Vortex Razor. While this scope is by no means in their league, I was shocked how good it was for the price...I thought it would become a paper weight, but I find myself taking it everywhere and thankfully it is light enough to be a pleasure to carry. Don’t expect pic resolution to stay strong out at 60x...it’s scientifically impossible without the glass used in the units that cost several hundred dollars. Very good in the 20-40x range.
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal & Value
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with product but not shipper. Box left out in the rain by shipper who found it to be too much trouble to push it four more feet against the house where it would stay dry. It's a good thing the product is designed for outdoor use.
customer_reviews.author: Roy G.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed: (
customer_reviews.text: Bought it 2 months ago but never got a chance to use it until this weekend ! Went to shooters ng range and when I open the box and set the scope the tripod is missing !!! Very disappointed :(
customer_reviews.author: rean lionelle lao

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mostly for viewing targets at long range so my spotter can call my hits, so I can then adjust accordingly. Probably use it for Bird and Wildlife watching too. It's very light, comes with a small tripod and carry case.
customer_reviews.author: Piscator

customer_reviews.title: Nice at price
customer_reviews.text: This spotting scope cost much less than one that I returned. It is clearer, easy to focus and includes a nice, table top tripod. It also comes with a nice carrying case. Less money and more scope.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Not worth at 60x
customer_reviews.text: For the money its worth it, for image quality and optics forget about it. As what others say its useless at 60x. The mechanical gears inside the scope jumps when focusing. Plastic tripod and not sturdy. I use my own tripod Am returning it and maybe move to Celestron C90.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've had this spotting scope at the range (25-100+ yards) for a few years now and have zero complaints. Would happily buy again or recommend to anyone else looking for a well-priced decent spotting scope.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value.
customer_reviews.text: I have used several MUCH more expensive spotting scopes and actually prefer this over many of those. While most likely not as durable, the picture quality is outstanding even at maximum zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Schlotter

customer_reviews.title: Suprising Quality
customer_reviews.text: This thing is way better than I expected for 70 dollars. Clear optics, HUGE magnification (it's pretty good for stargazing, even though I bought it as a spotting scope), and nicely compact. The tripod it comes with is cheap, but it's sturdy enough (it'll accept any camera tripod too). Main problem is how short it is and lack of adjustments, but that doesn't change the fact that the scope itself is great.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Lighter than expected but quality. Quality tri pod too. I can count pinecones on a tree at 60 from about 175-200 yards away. Its tough to get your eye in the right spot. That field of view is pretty narrow. I use it for scoping for bald eagles and other wildlife to shoot pics of
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: I have to say for the money it is excellent. I mainly use this as a spotting scope ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to say for the money it is excellent. I mainly use this as a spotting scope at the gun range. Out to 200 to 300 yards no problem at all. It's also fun for other uses too. It comes with it's own mini tripod that works well, plus a nice little carry bag. All in all good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Garry Varley

customer_reviews.title: Tripod & travel case & excellent optics at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I made this purchase on an advertised flash sale due to the valued price on a whim and hoped for the best.. Fortunately I got a terrific vale! I observed the full moon with great clarity and will use this for spotting on the rifle range next!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great spotting scope
customer_reviews.text: This will be a pretty short review. If you need a great spotting scope, this is it. Super stable, great optics and does everything you'll ever need for a spotting scope.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: It works and has good brightness.
customer_reviews.text: We were only able to test it for Archery at distances 50-90 meters. It worked perfectly for those distances. The 45 degree angle made sighting very comfortable once on a good tripod, I had to get a taller one versus what came with the package. The most prominent feedback was the brightness of the view versus other spotting telescopes. I haven't tried it on wet conditions to test how waterproof it is. We'll update should those conditions be needed. I don't think I'll dip it just to test it. :)
customer_reviews.author: Dvicesp

customer_reviews.title: This thing is super cheap priced for what you get
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super cheap priced for what you get. It does suffer in low light situations which is mostly what you need but I don't want to fork out $500 for a used spotting scope. This is a good first spotting scope. Maybe when I win the lottery I'll upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality!
customer_reviews.text: Everything in perfect quality. Couldn't ask for a better product for the price! Comes with good quality bag, instructions, micro cloth, stand and of course the scope itself. I've included 12 pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Light and practical.  Good scope for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, one for me and one for my dad. I was surprised with how light they are but it makes it that much easier to pack in & out. Tripod is great for prone position shooting and spotting. Only thing I wish was different is that the legs can be positioned but not screwed into place. I can foresee them getting loose with time because of that.
customer_reviews.author: R.H.

customer_reviews.title: fantastic scope
customer_reviews.text: I have a $300 spotting scope but wanted a less expensive one to keep at the range. This is better then my $300 spotting scope. I am well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: rw

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Wont focus clearly. Bought to capture wildlife pictures using iphone. Very hard to center phone on an once you do picture is fuzzy an wont clear up. Save your money for a good unit
customer_reviews.author: James H

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy for those in tall buildings!
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for my Son, he lives in an apartment downtown with some great views. This lets him zoom in on the things that happen in a big city. No issues to report- works perfectly, and works great in low-light conditions. Only thing it needed was a taller tripod but that's not a big deal. Always appreciate a helpful vote if you find my review to be interesting- thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for the money
customer_reviews.text: Took this inexpensive spotting scope to the range today. I have the pleasure of being a member of Shooters World in Orlando an air-conditioned, comfortable place which consists of a hundred yard range among many others. The shot was taken from my cell phone from the hundred yard line. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: James J.

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap scope
customer_reviews.text: Not your top end brand and glass quality however this scope is doing a very good damn job at 100, 200 yards. For the price and what it can do up to 200 yards cant be beat due the price. My son is a happy camper when at the range.
customer_reviews.author: Ocasio

product_meta.title: Emarth 20-60x60AE Waterproof Angled Spotting Scope with Tripod, 45-Degree Angled Eyepiece, Optics Zoom 39-19m/1000m for Target Shooting Bird Watching Hunting Wildlife Scenery (20-60x60) Green
feature_bullets: ✅【High Magnification】This spotting scope features a powerful zoom magnification range that adjustable 20x to 60x magnification,45 degree angled eyepiece ergonomic design allows more comfortable viewing. Field-of-view is 39-19m/1000m, brings nature closer to you than ever. Perfect for target shooting, hunting, bird watching wildlife, spotting moon, traveling, hiking, camping, archery, astronomy etc

✅【Fully Multi-coated Lens】The lens are all fully multi-coated and features BAK4 roof prism to increases light transmission and delivers bright, clear, high-contrast images even in low-light conditions. For long range viewing, a dual focus wheel system enables fast and fine-tuning focus adjustment,allows you to lock onto your target and zoom in for more detail clearly

✅【Durable Construction】High-quality rubber armor provides non-slip grip, shock-proof grip and durable external protection. Built-in retractable sunshade reduces glare, come with tripod allows rotation of the eyepiece to a sideways position, providing adjustable viewing angles

✅【Waterproof Fogproof 】The waterproof spotting scope provides exceptional performance in the most rugged conditions. the spotter scope optics are sealed with O-rings to prevent moisture, dust, and debris from getting inside the spotting scope, fogproof barrel is filled with nitrogen gas to inhibit internal fogging, completely protection for all weather conditions

✅【Emarth VIP Customer Service】 - Emarth offers lifetime VIP customer service for our customers, you are welcome to contact us if any problem with our optics products, our special line service will work hard to put a smile back on your face

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,565 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
